tool.name: Create GROMACS position restraints files
tool.command: ln -s '$gro_input' ./gro_input.gro && ln -s '$ndx_input' ./ndx_input.ndx && echo '$index' | gmx genrestr -f ./gro_input.gro -n ./ndx_input.ndx -o posre.itp -fc $fc &>> verbose.txt

param.label: Index (NDX) file
param.help: Index file containing the atoms which should be restrained

param.label: Force constants
param.help: Vector (in Cartesian space) specifying force constants for the restraints (kJ/mol nm^2)

validator.message: Only numeric values and whitespace allowed

param.label: Index of group
param.help: Index of group for calculating position restraints - i.e. the group's position in the ndx file (using zero-based numbering, so the first group has index 0).

param.name: capture_log
param.label: Generate detailed log
param.help: Generate detailed log information that can be summarized with ParseLog.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool calculates a position restraint (ITP) file for part of a system, specified in provided GRO and NDX files.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
- GRO structure file. - Index (NDX) file. - Force constant vector (in Cartesian space) for applying restraints. E.g. '1000 1000 1000' will apply a force constraint of 1000 kJ/mol nm^2 along each (XYZ) axis. - Index number of the group for which restraints should be calculated, i.e. the position of the group in the index file.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
- Position restraint (itp) file, which may be useful for system equilibration.
